intro: Elaeoselinum asclepium subsp. meoides, commonly known as the meadow wormwood, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs such as carrots and parsley. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats like meadows and grasslands, and it produces small, yellowish-green flowers in umbel-like clusters. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive, slightly aromatic scent. The subspecies is characterized by its slender stems and its ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
